recipe.title: Butter Beans, Paprika and Piquillo Peppers
recipe.section: These beans are great in salads. Let the mix cool and then toss through a selection of salad leaves and herbs. Perk up the leaves with a little olive oil and vinegar and some crispy lavash on top.

section.ingredient: 125 ml (about ½ cup) extra-virgin olive oil, divided

ingredient_group.ingredient: 1 Tbsp. dried chile flakes (preferably pul biber)

section.ingredient: 2 14-oz. cans butter beans or lima beans, drained and rinsed
300g (10 1/2-oz.) jarred piquillo peppers, rinsed and sliced

section.step: In a wide-based pan over a medium heat, caramelize the red onions in 5 Tbsp. of the olive oil for 15 minutes or until they turn golden and soft. Add a little fine salt, the garlic and spices and continue to cook for 2–3 minutes. Add the tomato purée and cook for another minute.
Add the beans and sherry vinegar and reduce the liquid by half over a medium heat. Turn the heat off. Add the piquillo peppers and the remaining olive oil and season with salt to serve.
